==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|alt=㝵,㕌}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|彳|㝵|ls=psc|c1=s|c2=p}}.

{{lang|zh|㝵}} is the ancient form of {{lang|zh|得}}, composed of {{zh-l|*貝|cowry}} + {{zh-l|*又|hand}}, i.e. “to obtain valuables”.

|m-s=de2
|c=dak1
|h=pfs=tet

|mn=tek/chek
|mn_note=chek - vernacular; tek - literary
|w=4teq
|mc=y

}}

====Definitions====
{{zh-hanzi}}

# to [[get]]; to [[obtain]]; to [[gain]], to [[acquire]]
#: {{zh-x|他 得{dé} 了 個 壞 名聲。|He gained a bad reputation.}}
# to [[contract]] (disease); to become [[ill]] with
# to [[result]] in; to [[produce]]
# to be [[ready]]; [[finished]]
# to [[suit]]; to [[fit]]
# [[fit]]; [[proper]]
# [[satisfied]]; [[contented]]
# {{n-g|used before verbs to express possibility and permissibility, usually used in the negative}}
# {{anchor|enough}}{{n-g|interjective particle expressing approval or prohibition; see {{lang|zh|[[得了#Etymology 3|得了]]}}}}
#: {{zh-x|得{dé} 了，別 再 說 了。|OK! OK! That's enough.}}
# {{n-g|interjective particle expressing frustration or helplessness}}

===Pronunciation 2===
{{zh-pron
|m=de,di
|m_note=di is used in poetry, songs
|c=dak1
|ma=y
|dial=n
|cat=part
}}

====Definitions====
{{zh-hanzi}}

# {{n-g|Used after a verb or an adjective and before a complement.}}
#: {{zh-x|好 得{de} 很|very good}}
#: {{zh-x|他 痛 得{de} 直 哭。|He feels great pain, crying.}}
#: {{zh-x|他 跑 得{de} 快。|He runs fast.}}
#: {{zh-x|他 跑 得{de} 像 一 阵 风。|He runs like wind.}}
#: {{zh-x|看 得{de} 見|able to see}}
#: {{zh-x|他 畫 得{de} 好。|He paints well.}}
#: {{zh-x|賣 得 幾多 錢？|How much '''can''' it sell for?|C|ref={{lang|zh|《{{w|yue:氹氹轉，菊花園|氹氹轉，菊花園}}》}}}}
# {{n-g|Used after a verb to express possibility or capability.}}
#: {{zh-x|吃 得{de}|eatable, edible}}
#: {{zh-x|做 不 得{de}|must not be done}}
#: {{zh-x|這 雙 鞋 穿 得{de}。|These shoes fit well.}}
#: {{zh-x|這 個 人 批評 不 得{de}。|He's not a man to criticize.}}

====Usage notes====
* When it is used between a verb and the complement, and the complement is used to indicate possibility or capacity, the negative form replaces {{lang|zh|得}} with {{zh-l|不}}.
** {{zh-x|寫 得{de} 好|able to write well}}
** {{zh-x|寫 不 好|unable to write well}}
*: If there is no complement, or if the complement describes the result or the extent of the verb, the negative form has {{zh-l|得[[不]]}} in the place of {{lang|zh|得}}.
*:* {{zh-x|寫 得{de} 好|write well}}
*:* {{zh-x|寫 得{de} 不 好|write not well}}
* If it is used after a verb-object construction, the verb is repeated again as "verb-object-verb-{{lang|zh|得}}-complement".
** {{zh-x|寫字 寫 得{de} 好|write characters well}}
*: "Object-verb-{{lang|zh|得}}-complement" is also used.
*:* {{zh-x|字 寫 得{de} 好|characters being well-written}}
